comments.body: There is lot of timeouts in this struct that are never used in this PR. Does it make sense to pre-allocate them for subsequent, non-storage PRs?

My original idea was to:

1. Move all timeouts to this struct
2. Deprecate the original values used here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f975a2d485ca7ce559d437ed6a1b07111bf1404d/test/e2e/framework/util.go#L86
3. Use the values from this struct _in all e2e tests_, not only storage tests.

However, when I got to step 3 above I noticed that this PR would become excessively big, so I started with storage tests only and hoped that eventually the other tests would use these values instead (since the values in utils.go are deprecated).

Does this make sense or should I just add to this struct the timeouts I'm going to use in storage tests?

The reason I wanted to do this is because currently timeout values are scattered around framework package: utils.go, pv/pv.go etc. So I'd like this file to be the source of truth for all values.
Keeping the timeouts in a single place (timeouts.go) makes the code readable. I think we can start with the timeouts we are using in storage tests.
Sounds good. Removed everything that was not used.

Can we create const for the default timeout values in this file? and then use them here.
e.g PVBindingTimeout etc
minor nit: its more readable to keep the timeouts for a given resource together. e.g claimProvisionTimeout, claimProvisionShortTimeout, claimBoundTimeout

Good point, fixed. 

Re-ordered the consts here, the fields in the declaration of `TimeoutContext` struct and the fields where it's initialized.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@	podStartSlowTimeout        = 15 * time.Minute
	podDeleteTimeout           = 5 * time.Minute
	claimProvisionTimeout      = 5 * time.Minute
	claimProvisionShortTimeout = 1 * time.Minute
	claimBoundTimeout          = 3 * time.Minute

comments.body: same comment as above about grouping resources together.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +87,91 @@		PodStartSlow:        podStartSlowTimeout,
		PodDelete:           podDeleteTimeout,
		ClaimProvision:      claimProvisionTimeout,
		ClaimProvisionShort: claimProvisionShortTimeout,
		ClaimBound:          claimBoundTimeout,
